metadata.Description: A technology that harnesses the temperature difference between warm surface water and cold deep water to generate electricity.

level 1.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion addresses climate change adaptation by providing a sustainable energy solution that reduces reliance on fossil fuels.
Ocean thermal energy conversion employs heat exchangers to convert temperature differences in ocean water into usable energy.
Ocean thermal energy conversion collaborates with coastal communities to implement sustainable energy solutions and support local economies.
Ocean thermal energy conversion supports research in renewable energy technologies to improve efficiency and expand the use of sustainable energy sources.
Ocean thermal energy conversion administers government incentive programs to promote the adoption of sustainable energy technologies.
Ocean thermal energy conversion measures ocean temperature to identify suitable locations for harnessing thermal energy.
Ocean thermal energy conversion aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals by providing a clean and renewable energy source for sustainable development.
Ocean thermal energy conversion is an instance of ocean energy, which utilizes temperature differences in ocean water to generate electricity.
